member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.GeoPoint
member.summary: Represents point on the Earth surface with geographical coordinates

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.GeoPoint.Longitude
member.summary: Longitude of the point, in degrees, from 0 to ±180, positive East, negative West. 0 is a point on prime meridian.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.GeoPoint.Latitude
member.summary: Latitude of the point, in degrees, from +90 (North pole) to -90 (South Pole). 0 is a point on equator.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GeoPoint.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates new instance of and initializes it with longitude and latitude values.
member.param: Longitude of the point, in degrees, from 0 to ±180, positive East, negative West. 0 is a point on prime meridian.
Latitude of the point, in degrees, from +90 (North pole) to -90 (South Pole). 0 is a point on equator.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions
member.summary: Set of useful graphics extensions

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.DrawPolyline(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.PointF[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Draws polyline. This method is more optimized than default because it draws only visible segments of the line.
member.param: Array of points defining the polyline
Flag indicating the line is closed one (last point should be connected with first point)

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.DrawGraphicsPath(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath,System.Drawing.Brush,System.Drawing.Pen)
member.summary: Draws graphics path, optionally with fill and/or outline

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.Nearest(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF[])
member.summary: Finds nearest points for a point with specified coordinates
member.param: Point to find nearest point for.
Array of points to select nearest one.
member.returns: Nearest point from the array closest to the specified one.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.FindVisiblePartOfSegment(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Finds visible part of segment
member.returns: Visible part of segment, i.e. first and last points

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.FindClipBoundsIntersections(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Finds intersections of a line segment with clip bounds
member.returns: Intersection points. Count can be from 0 to 2.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.SegmentsIntersection(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Finds point of intersection of two segments
member.returns: Point of intersection of two segments, or null if no intersection

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.VectorMult(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Multiplies two vectors defined by coordinates

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.GraphicsExtensions.LineEquation(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Calculates constants of a line equation by two points lie on that line.
member.param: First point lies on the line
Second point lies on the line

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.MapControl.ProcessRequests
member.summary: Background worker function. Processes images requests if requests pool is not empty, than stops the execution until the pool gets new image request. Breaks execution on disposing.

member.summary: Gets projection of geographical coordinates onto the map
member.returns: object representing projection of the specified geographical coordinates on the map.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.MapControl.ClearCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clears map cache. If flag is set to true, cache for all tile servers will be cleared. If no, only current tile server cache will be cleared.
member.param: If flag is set to true, cache for all tile servers will be cleared.

member.summary: Gets tile validity period of a tile image. Tile will be requested again from the tile server if the tile's image file from the file system cache is older than specified value.

member.summary: Attribution text that will be displayed in bottom-right corner of the map. Can be null (no attribution text) or can contain html links for navigating with default system web browser.

member.summary: User-Agent string used to dowload tile images from the tile server.
member.remarks: OpenStreetMap requires valid HTTP User-Agent identifying application. Faking app's User-Agent may get you blocked.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Forms.OpenStreetMapTileServer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new instance of .
member.param: User-Agent string used to dowload tile images from OpenStreetMap tile servers.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Forms.WebTileServer
member.summary: Base class for all web tile servers

member.summary: Gets tile URI by X and Y coordinates of the tile and zoom level Z.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.WebTileServer.UserAgent
member.summary: User-Agent string used to dowload tile images from the tile server.
member.remarks: Some web tile servers (for example OpenStreetMap) require valid HTTP User-Agent identifying application. Faking app's User-Agent may get you blocked.

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.WebTileServer.TileExpirationPeriod
member.summary: Tile expiration period.
member.remarks: Different tile servers have various tile usage policies, so do not set small values here to prevent loading same tiles from the server frequently. For example, for OpenStretMap tile expiration period should not be smaller than 7 days:

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.WebTileServer.Name
member.summary: Displayable name of the tile server, i.e. human-readable map name, for example, "Open Street Map".

member.name: P:System.Windows.Forms.WebTileServer.AttributionText
member.summary: Attribution text that will be displayed in bottom-right corner of the map. Can be null (no attribution text) or can contain html links for navigating with default system web browser.
